channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Breonna Taylor's family lawyer speaks about ex-police officer's sentencing
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with civil rights attorney Benjamin Crump about the sentencing of a former police officer involved in the raid that killed Breonna Taylor.

item.title: National Urban League says Trump's policies amount to emergency for Black Americans
item.description: One of the nation's oldest Civil Rights organization warns the Trump administration's policies have thrust the country into a "state of emergency" for antidiscrimination policies, personal freedoms and black economic advancement.

item.title: Texas church reaches out to flood victims who are afraid to seek help
item.description: Aid has been pouring into areas affected by the devastating Texas floods. But those in the U.S. illegally are reluctant to seek help, fearing arrest. A church is helping them collect what they need.

item.title: 'Star Trek: Strange New Worlds' returns
item.description: Star Trek: Strange New Worlds, the latest TV iteration of the nearly 60-year-old franchise, debuts its third season on Paramount+ this week. NPR spoke with members of the cast.

item.title: As Epstein outrage continues, Department of Justice asks to question Ghislane Maxwell
item.description: As Trump supporters continue to demand answers in the Epstein case, today the DOJ requested to question jailed Epstein associate Ghislane Maxwell.

item.title: Can the U.S. sugar supply meet demand for Coca-Cola's cane sugar change?
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Kevin Combs of McKeany-Flavell about the U.S. sugar industry's capacity to meet demand for a new Coke drink made with U.S. cane sugar.

item.title: Trump says he isn't following Epstein developments â€” and changes the subject
item.description: President Trump says he was unaware of the latest developments in the Epstein backlash and pivots to his complaints about the Obama administration.

item.title: Jason Reynolds talks about the realities of caregiving for his aging mom
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Author Jason Reynolds talks about the realities of caregiving for his aging mom.

item.title: Flat-tire scam in Bogota leads motorists to repair shops that rip them off
item.description: Bogota's police crackdown on the tire puncturing scammers wreaking havoc on the Colombian capitals unsuspecting motorists

item.title: Why the price of rice is so high in Japan
item.description: The price of rice in Japan has doubled in the last year. NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with University of Pittsburgh scholar Kay Shimizu about what's behind the shortage in the homeland of sushi.
